page.title: 11TOURISM-PORTPATRICK
page.content: Portpatrick depends almost entirely on tourism for its livelyhood.By the sea, yet set in beautiful countryside and within short driving distance of the forest parks in the Galloway Hills, it is a centre for touring and walking holidays,the latter becoming more popular in recent years since Portpatrick is now recommended as the start for{The Southern Upland Way,}a walk crossing southern Scotland from coast to coast. The village and immediate area offers golf,bowling,tennis,sea-angling and pony-trekking, while local hotels and restuarants enjoy a well-deserved reputation for excellent cuisine. Accomodation ranges from "A.A. Two-Star"through private hotels and homely boarding houses to caravan parks and camping sites.
